title: A Covid-19 Vaccine Could Unleash Pent-Up Demand, Bringing Along Inflation
sub_head: A return to pre-pandemic lives may bring a surge in spending, some analysts say
body:
Inflation could be poised for a comeback.
Some economists are starting to embrace the idea that a prospective Covid-19 vaccine could allow people to once again spend money on travel, restaurants and other services—and drive up prices in the U.S.
That would be a change from the past 10 years, when inflation rarely hit the Federal Reserve’s...
